text: Alexander Lambert (November 1, 1863 – December 31, 1929) was a pianist and a piano teacher, who was struck and killed by a taxicab in Manhattan, New York City. ==Biography== He was born on November 1, 1863 in Warsaw, Poland to Henry Lambert. After moving to New York, he was faculty of New York College of Music. Among his students included Jerome Kern and Alfred Newman. He died on New Year's Eve 1929 in Manhattan when he was struck and killed by a taxicab. He left an estate with a net value of $273,457, , and was buried in Washington Cemetery in Brooklyn. ==References== Category:Pedestrian road incident deaths Category:1863 births Category:1929 deaths Category:American pianists Category:Polish emigrants to the United States Category:Imperial Russian emigrants to the United States Category:American male pianists
title: Alexander Lambert
